intro: Senecio franchetii, commonly known as the Franchet's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Senecio franchetii is considered a rare and endangered species.
